nodes.label: Post-7:00 NY AM Routine — Hunt EQL → Liquidity Engagement → FVG Mapping
nodes.speaker_quote: At 7 o'clock in the morning that begins your hunt for relative equal highs or relative equal lows… do not look for your relative equal highs or lows prior to 7 o'clock.

nodes.label: Fair Value Gap (FVG) — Down-Close SIBI
nodes.speaker_quote: A down close fair value gap is… sell-side imbalance, buy-side inefficiency; it offered delivery on the downside and any movement back up into that range is inefficient.

nodes.label: Volume Imbalance (Body-to-Body Gap)
nodes.speaker_quote: The volume imbalance is the separation between one candlestick’s body and the very next subsequent candlestick; if the bodies don’t overlap or at least touch, there’s a volume imbalance.

nodes.label: Inversion FVG & Consequent Encroachment (CE) Usage
nodes.speaker_quote: If it goes above the fair value gap and comes back down, I can use that candle’s wick and halfway point of it—that’s how far I can retrace back into it; it becomes an inversion fair value gap.

nodes.label: Relative Equal Highs (EQL) — Post-7:00 Hunt
nodes.speaker_quote: At 7 o’clock in the morning… begin your hunt for relative equal highs or relative equal lows.

nodes.label: Relative Equal Lows (REL) — Post-7:00 Formation
nodes.speaker_quote: You’re waiting to see relative equal highs and relative equal lows form after post-7 a.m. New York local time.

nodes.label: Buy-Side Liquidity (BSL) Taken Above Highs
nodes.speaker_quote: It took buy-side… after it took that buy-side where did it go directionally? Lower.

nodes.label: Draw Beyond REL/EQL Using Outside Structure
nodes.speaker_quote: If these become relative equal lows and it wants to go below that… how far can it go? Refer over there—outside this parameter you look at structure.

nodes.label: Post-7:00 a.m. New York (NY AM Session Start)
nodes.speaker_quote: 7 o’clock in the morning… New York local time—that’s your beginning of the day.

nodes.label: 15m/5m/1m Intraday Framework (No HTF)
nodes.speaker_quote: I’m not using anything higher than a 15-minute time frame… for intraday trading you don’t need a daily or hourly chart.

nodes.label: 9:30 a.m. NY Opening Bell Reference
nodes.speaker_quote: I won’t be with you after the opening bell at 9:30 eastern time—keep this short study going into the open.

nodes.label: Residual/Unfilled Portion of FVG (Precision Re-entry)
nodes.speaker_quote: Your eye should jump to the little remaining section… I’ve placed limit orders just below it and it runs with no significant drawdown.

nodes.label: Ignore Wicks Inside FVG When VIB Exists
nodes.speaker_quote: If you have a fair value gap and it has a volume imbalance in it, any wick inside that FVG—completely disregard it.
